name: ACANA
description: fast heuristic anchor based pairwise alignment

name: AlignMe
description: Alignments for membrane protein sequences

name: Bioconductor
description: Dynamic programming

name: (BioPerl OR dpAlign)
description: Dynamic programming

name: (BLASTZ OR LASTZ)
description: Seeded pattern-matching

name: CUDAlign
description: DNA sequence alignment of unrestricted size in single or multiple GPUs

name: DNADot
description: Web-based dot-plot tool

name: DOTLET
description: Java-based dot-plot tool

name: FEAST
description: Posterior based local extension with descriptive evolution model

name: G-PAS
description: GPU-based dynamic programming with backtracking

name: GapMis
description: GapMis is a tool for pairwise sequence alignment with a single gap

name: (GGSEARCH OR GLSEARCH)
description: Global:Global (GG), Global:Local (GL) alignment with statistics

name: JAligner
description: Open source Java implementation of Smith-Waterman

name: K Sync
description: Protein sequence to structure alignment that includes secondary structure, structural conservation, structure-derived sequence profiles, and consensus alignment scores

name: LALIGN
description: Multiple, non-overlapping, local similarity (same algorithm as SIM)

name: NW-align
description: Standard Needleman-Wunsch dynamic programming algorithm

name: mAlign
description: modelling alignment; models the information content of the sequences

name: matcher
description: Waterman-Eggert local alignment (based on LALIGN)

name: MCALIGN2
description: explicit models of indel evolution

name: MUMmer
description: suffix tree based

name: needle
description: Needleman-Wunsch dynamic programming

name: Ngila
description: logarithmic and affine gap costs and explicit models of indel evolution

name: parasail
description: C/C++/Python SIMD dynamic programming library for SSE, AVX2

name: Path
description: Smith-Waterman on protein back-translation graph (detects frameshifts at protein level)

name: PatternHunter
description: Seeded pattern-matching

name: ProbA
description: Stochastic partition function sampling via dynamic programming

name: PyMOL
description: "align" command aligns sequence & applies it to structure

name: REPuter
description: suffix tree based

name: SABERTOOTH
description: Alignment using predicted Connectivity Profiles

name: Satsuma
description: Parallel whole-genome synteny alignments

name: SEQALN
description: Various dynamic programming

name: (SIM GAP NAP LAP) OR ((SIM OR GAP OR NAP OR LAP)
description: Local similarity with varying gap treatments

name: SIM
description: Local similarity

name: SPA Super
description: Fast pairwise global alignment

name: SSEARCH
description: Local (Smith-Waterman) alignment with statistics

name: Sequences Studio
description: Java applet demonstrating various algorithms from [19]

name: SWIFT suit
description: Fast Local Alignment Searching

name: stretcher
description: Memory-optimized Needleman-Wunsch dynamic programming

name: tranalign
description: Aligns nucleic acid sequences given a protein alignment

name: UGENE
description: Opensource Smith-Waterman for SSE/CUDA, Suffix array based repeats finder & dotplot

name: water
description: Smith-Waterman dynamic programming

name: wordmatch
description: k-tuple pairwise match

name: YASS
description: Seeded pattern-matching

name: ABA
description: A-Bruijn alignment

name: ALE
description: manual alignmentÿ; some software assistance

name: AMAP
description: Sequence annealing

name: anon
description: fast, optimal alignment of three sequences using linear gap costs

name: BAli-Phy
description: Tree+Multi alignmentÿ; Probabilistic/Bayesianÿ; Joint Estimation

name: Base-By-Base
description: Java-based multiple sequence alignment editor with integrated analysis tools

name: CHAOS DIALIGN
description: Iterative alignment

name: ClustalW
description: Progressive alignment

name: CodonCode Aligner
description: Multi alignment; ClustalW & Phrap support

name: Compass
description: COmparison of Multiple Protein sequence Alignments with assessment of Statistical Significance

name: DECIPHER
description: Progressive/iterative alignment

name: (DIALIGN-TX OR DIALIGN-T)
description: Segment-based method

name: (DIALIGN OR DIALIGN-T)
description: Segment-based method

name: DNA Alignment
description: Segment-based method for intraspecific alignments

name: DNA Baser Sequence Assembler
description: Multi alignment; Automatic batch alignment

name: EDNA
description: Energy Based Multiple Sequence Alignment for DNA Binding Sites

name: FSA
description: Sequence annealing

name: Geneious
description: Progressive/Iterative alignment; ClustalW plugin

name: Kalign
description: Progressive alignment

name: MAFFT
description: Progressive/iterative alignment

name: MARNA
description: Multiple Alignment of RNAs

name: MAVID
description: Progressive alignment

name: MSA
description: Dynamic programming

name: MSAProbs
description: Dynamic programming

name: MULTALIN
description: Dynamic programming/clustering

name: Multi-LAGAN
description: Progressive dynamic programming alignment

name: MUSCLE
description: Progressive/iterative alignment

name: Opal
description: Progressive/iterative alignment

name: Pecan
description: Probabilistic/consistency

name: Phylo
description: A human computing framework for comparative genomics to solve multiple alignment

name: Praline
description: Progressive/iterative/consistency/homology-extended alignment with pre-profiling and secondary structure prediction

name: PicXAA
description: non-progressive/maximum expected accuracy alignment

name: POA
description: Partial order/hidden Markov model

name: Probalign
description: Probabilistic/consistency with partition function probabilities

name: ProbCons
description: Probabilistic/consistency

name: PROMALS3D
description: Progressive alignment/hidden Markov model/Secondary structure/3D structure

name: PRRN PRRP
description: Iterative alignment (especially refinement)

name: PSAlign
description: Alignment preserving non-heuristic

name: RevTrans
description: Combines DNA and Protein alignment, by back translating the protein alignment to DNA.

name: SAGA
description: Sequence alignment by genetic algorithm

name: SAM
description: Hidden Markov model

name: Se-Al
description: Manual alignment

name: StatAlign
description: Bayesian co-estimation of alignment and phylogeny (MCMC)

name: Stemloc
description: Multiple alignment and secondary structure prediction

name: T-Coffee
description: More sensitive progressive alignment

name: UGENE
description: Supports multiple alignment with MUSCLE, KAlign, Clustal and MAFFT plugins

name: VectorFriends
description: VectorFriends Aligner, MUSCLE plugin, and ClustalW plugin

name: GLProbs
description: Adaptive pair-Hidden Markov Model based approach

name: ACT Artemis
description: Synteny and comparative genomics

name: BarraCUDA
description: A GPGPU accelerated Burrows-Wheeler transform (FM-index) short read alignment program based on BWA, supports alignment of indels with gap openings and extensions.

name: BBMap
description: Uses a short kmers to rapidly index genome; no size or scaffold count limit. Higher sensitivity and specificity than Burrows-Wheeler aligners, with similar or greater speed. Performs affine-transform-optimized global alignment, which is slower but more accurate than Smith-Waterman. Handles Illumina, 454, PacBio, Sanger, and Ion Torrent data. Splice-aware; capable of processing long indels and RNA-seq. Pure Java; runs on any platform. Used by the Joint Genome Institute.

name: BFAST
description: Explicit time and accuracy tradeoff with a prior accuracy estimation, supported by indexing the reference sequences. Optimally compresses indexes. Can handle billions of short reads. Can handle insertions, deletions, SNPs, and color errors (can map ABI SOLiD color space reads). Performs a full Smith Waterman alignment.

name: BLASTN
description: BLAST's nucleotide alignment program, slow and not accurate for short reads, and uses a sequence database (EST, sanger sequence) rather than a reference genome.

name: BLAT
description: Made by Jim Kent. Can handle one mismatch in initial alignment step.

name: Bowtie
description: Uses a Burrows-Wheeler transform to create a permanent, reusable index of the genome; 1.3 GB memory footprint for human genome. Aligns more than 25 million Illumina reads in 1 CPU hour. Supports Maq-like and SOAP-like alignment policies

name: HIVE-hexagon
description: Uses a hash table and bloom matrix to create and filter potential positions on the genome. For higher efficiency uses cross-similarity between short reads and avoids realigning non unique redundant sequences. It is faster than bowtie and bwa and allows indels and divergent sensitive alignments on viruses and bacteria as well as more conservative eukaryotic alignments.

name: BWA
description: Uses a Burrows-Wheeler transform to create an index of the genome. It's a bit slower than bowtie but allows indels in alignment.

name: BWA-PSSM
description: A probabilistic short read aligner based on the use of position specific scoring matrices (PSSM). The aligner is adaptable in the sense that it can take into account the quality scores of the reads and models of data specific biases, such as those observed in Ancient DNA, PAR-CLIP data or genomes with biased nucleotide compositions.[28]

name: CASHX
description: Quantify and manage large quantities of short-read sequence data. CASHX pipeline contains a set of tools that can be used together or as independent modules on their own. This algorithm is very accurate for perfect hits to a reference genome.

name: Cloudburst
description: Short-read mapping using Hadoop MapReduce

name: CUDA-EC
description: Short-read alignment error correction using GPUs.

name: CUSHAW
description: A CUDA compatible short read aligner to large genomes based on Burrows-Wheeler transform.

name: CUSHAW2
description: Gapped short-read and long-read alignment based on maximal exact match seeds. This aligner supports both base-space (e.g. from Illumina, 454, Ion Torrent and PacBio sequencers) and ABI SOLiD color-space read alignments.

name: CUSHAW2-GPU
description: GPU-accelerated CUSHAW2 short-read aligner.

name: CUSHAW3
description: Sensitive and Accurate Base-Space and Color-Space Short-Read Alignment with Hybrid Seeding

name: drFAST
description: Read mapping alignment software that implements cache obliviousness to minimize main/cache memory transfers like mrFAST and mrsFAST, however designed for the SOLiD sequencing platform (color space reads). It also returns all possible map locations for improved structural variation discovery.

name: ELAND
description: Implemented by Illumina. Includes ungapped alignment with a finite read length.

name: ERNE
description: Extended Randomized Numerical alignEr for accurate alignment of NGS reads. It can map bisulfite-treated reads.

name: GASSST
description: Finds global alignments of short DNA sequences against large DNA banks

name: GEM
description: High-quality alignment engine (exhaustive mapping with substitutions and indels). More accurate and several times faster than BWA or Bowtie 1/2. Many standalone biological applications (mapper, split mapper, mappability, and other) provided.

name: Genalice MAP
description: Ultra fast and comprehensive NGS read aligner with high precision and small storage footprint.

name: Geneious Assembler
description: Fast, accurate overlap assembler with the ability to handle any combination of sequencing technology, read length, any pairing orientations, with any spacer size for the pairing, with or without a reference genome.

name: GensearchNGS
description: Complete framework with user-friendly GUI to analyse NGS data. It integrates a proprietary high quality alignment algorithm as well as plug-in capability to integrate various public aligner into a framework allowing to import short reads, align them, detect variants and generate reports. It is geared towards re-sequencing projects, namely in a diagnostic setting.

name: (GMAP OR GSNAP)
description: Robust, fast short-read alignment. GMAP: longer reads, with multiple indels and splices (see entry above under Genomics analysis); GSNAP: shorter reads, with a single indel or up to two splices per read. Useful for digital gene expression, SNP and indel genotyping. Developed by Thomas Wu at Genentech. Used by the National Center for Genome Resources (NCGR) in Alpheus.

name: GNUMAP
description: Accurately performs gapped alignment of sequence data obtained from next-generation sequencing machines (specifically that of Solexa/Illumina) back to a genome of any size. Includes adaptor trimming, SNP calling and Bisulfite sequence analysis.

name: iSAAC
description: iSAAC has been designed to take full advantage of all the computational power available on a single server node. As a result iSAAC scales well over a broad range of hardware architectures, and alignment performance improves with hardware capabilities

name: LAST
description: LAST uses adaptative seeds and copes more efficiently with repeat-rich sequences (e.g. genomes). For example: it can align reads to genomes without repeat-masking, without becoming overwhelmed by repetitive hits.

name: MAQ
description: Ungapped alignment that takes into account quality scores for each base.

name: (mrFAST OR FAST)
description: Gapped (mrFAST) and ungapped (mrsFAST) alignment software that implements cache obliviousness to minimize main/cache memory transfers. They are designed for the Illumina sequencing platform and they can return all possible map locations for improved structural variation discovery.

name: MOM
description: MOM or maximum oligonucleotide mapping is a query matching tool that captures a maximal length match within the short read.

name: MOSAIK
description: Fast gapped aligner and reference-guided assembler. Aligns reads using a banded Smith-Waterman algorithm seeded by results from a k-mer hashing scheme. Supports reads ranging in size from very short to very long.

name: MPscan
description: Fast aligner based on a filtration strategy (no indexing, use q-grams and Backward Nondeterministic DAWG Matching)

name: (Novoalign OR NovoalignCS)
description: Gapped alignment of single end and paired end Illumina GA I & II, ABI Colour space & ION Torrent reads.. High sensitivity and specificity, using base qualities at all steps in the alignment. Includes adapter trimming, base quality calibration, Bi-Seq alignment, and option to report multiple alignments per read.

name: NextGENe
description: NextGENe? software has been developed specifically for use by biologists performing analysis of next generation sequencing data from Roche Genome Sequencer FLX, Illumina GA/HiSeq, Life Technologies Applied BioSystems? SOLiD? System, PacBio and Ion Torrent platforms.

name: NextGenMap
description: Flexible and fast read mapping program (twice as fast as BWA), achieves a mapping sensitivity comparable to Stampy. Internally uses a memory efficient index structure (hash table) to store the positions of all 13-mers present in the reference genome. Mapping regions where pairwise alignments are required are dynamically determined for each read. Uses fast SIMD instructions (SSE) to accelerate the alignment calculations on the CPU. If available, alignments are computed on the GPU (using OpenCL/CUDA) resulting in an additional runtime reduction of 20 - 50%.

name: Omixon
description: The Omixon Variant Toolkit includes highly sensitive and highly accurate tools for detecting SNPs and indels. It offers a solution to map NGS short reads with a moderate distance (up to 30% sequence divergence) from reference genomes. It poses no restrictions on the size of the reference, which, combined with its high sensitivity, makes the Variant Toolkit well-suited for targeted sequencing projects and diagnostics.

name: PALMapper
description: PALMapper, efficiently computes both spliced and unspliced alignments at high accuracy. Relying on a machine learning strategy combined with a fast mapping based on a banded Smith-Waterman-like algorithm it aligns around 7 million reads per hour on a single CPU. It refines the originally proposed QPALMA approach.

name: Partek
description: Partek? Flow software has been developed specifically for use by biologists and bioinformaticians. It supports un-gapped, gapped and splice-junction alignment from single and paired-end reads from Illumina, Life technologies Solid TM, Roche 454 and Ion Torrent raw data (with or without quality information). It integrates powerful quality control on FASTQ/Qual level and on aligned data. Additional functionality include trimming and filtering of raw reads, SNP and InDel detection, mRNA and microRNA quantification and fusion gene detection.

name: PASS
description: Indexes the genome, then extends seeds using pre-computed alignments of words. Works with base space as well as color space (SOLID) and can align genomic and spliced RNA-seq reads.

name: PerM
description: Indexes the genome with periodic seeds to quickly find alignments with full sensitivity up to four mismatches. It can map Illumina and SOLiD reads. Unlike most mapping programs, speed increases for longer read lengths.

name: PRIMEX
description: Indexes the genome with a k-mer lookup table with full sensitivity up to an adjustable number of mismatches. It is best for mapping 15-60bp sequences to a genome.

name: QPalma
description: Is able to take advantage of quality scores, intron lengths and computation splice site predictions to perform and performs an unbiased alignment. Can be trained to the specifics of a RNA-seq experiment and genome. Useful for splice site/intron discovery and for gene model building. (See PALMapper for a faster version).

name: RazerS
description: No read length limit. Hamming or edit distance mapping with configurable error rates. Configurable and predictable sensitivity (runtime/sensitivity tradeoff). Supports paired-end read mapping.

name: cREAL
description: REAL is an efficient, accurate, and sensitive tool for aligning short reads obtained from next-generation sequencing. The programme can handle an enormous amount of single-end reads generated by the next-generation Illumina/Solexa Genome Analyzer. cREAL is a simple extension of REAL for aligning short reads obtained from next-generation sequencing to a genome with circular structure.

name: REAL
description: REAL is an efficient, accurate, and sensitive tool for aligning short reads obtained from next-generation sequencing. The programme can handle an enormous amount of single-end reads generated by the next-generation Illumina/Solexa Genome Analyzer. cREAL is a simple extension of REAL for aligning short reads obtained from next-generation sequencing to a genome with circular structure.

name: RMAP
description: Can map reads with or without error probability information (quality scores) and supports paired-end reads or bisulfite-treated read mapping. There are no limitations on read length or number of mismatches.

name: rNA
description: A randomized Numerical Aligner for Accurate alignment of NGS reads

name: RTG Investigator
description: Extremely fast, tolerant to high indel and substitution counts. Includes full read alignment. Product includes comprehensive pipelines for variant detection and metagenomic analysis with any combination of Illumina, Complete Genomics and Roche 454 data.

name: Segemehl
description: Can handle insertions, deletions and mismatches. Uses enhanced suffix arrays.

name: SeqMap
description: Up to 5 mixed substitutions and insertions/deletions. Various tuning options and input/output formats.

name: Shrec
description: Short read error correction with a Suffix trie data structure.

name: SHRiMP
description: Indexes the reference genome as of version 2. Uses masks to generate possible keys. Can map ABI SOLiD color space reads.

name: SLIDER
description: Slider is an application for the Illumina Sequence Analyzer output that uses the "probability" files instead of the sequence files as an input for alignment to a reference sequence or a set of reference sequences.

name: SOAP
description: SOAP: Robust with a small (1-3) number of gaps and mismatches. Speed improvement over BLAT, uses a 12 letter hash table. SOAP2: using bidirectional BWT to build the index of reference, and it is much faster than the first version. SOAP3: GPU-accelerated version that could find all 4-mismatch alignments in tens of seconds per one million reads. SOAP3-dp, also GPU accelerated, supports arbitrary number of mismatches and gaps according to affine gap penalty scores.

name: SOAP2
description: SOAP: Robust with a small (1-3) number of gaps and mismatches. Speed improvement over BLAT, uses a 12 letter hash table. SOAP2: using bidirectional BWT to build the index of reference, and it is much faster than the first version. SOAP3: GPU-accelerated version that could find all 4-mismatch alignments in tens of seconds per one million reads. SOAP3-dp, also GPU accelerated, supports arbitrary number of mismatches and gaps according to affine gap penalty scores.

name: SOAP3
description: SOAP: Robust with a small (1-3) number of gaps and mismatches. Speed improvement over BLAT, uses a 12 letter hash table. SOAP2: using bidirectional BWT to build the index of reference, and it is much faster than the first version. SOAP3: GPU-accelerated version that could find all 4-mismatch alignments in tens of seconds per one million reads. SOAP3-dp, also GPU accelerated, supports arbitrary number of mismatches and gaps according to affine gap penalty scores.

name: SOAP3-dp
description: SOAP: Robust with a small (1-3) number of gaps and mismatches. Speed improvement over BLAT, uses a 12 letter hash table. SOAP2: using bidirectional BWT to build the index of reference, and it is much faster than the first version. SOAP3: GPU-accelerated version that could find all 4-mismatch alignments in tens of seconds per one million reads. SOAP3-dp, also GPU accelerated, supports arbitrary number of mismatches and gaps according to affine gap penalty scores.

name: SOCS
description: For ABI SOLiD technologies. Significant increase in time to map reads with mismatches (or color errors). Uses an iterative version of the Rabin-Karp string search algorithm.

name: SSAHA
description: Fast for a small number of variants.

name: SSAHA2
description: Fast for a small number of variants.

name: Stampy
description: For Illumina reads. High specificity, and sensitive for reads with indels, structural variants, or many SNPs. Slow, but speed increased dramatically by using BWA for first alignment pass).

name: SToRM
description: For Illumina or ABI SOLiD reads, with SAM native output. Highly sensitive for reads with many errors, indels (full from 0 to 15, extended support otherwise). Uses spaced seeds (single hit) and a very fast SSE/SSE2/AVX2/AVX-512 banded alignment filter. For fixed-length reads only, authors recommend SHRiMP2 otherwise.

name: Subread
description: Superfast and accurate read aligners. Subread can be used to map both gDNA-seq and RNA-seq reads. Subjunc detects exon-exon junctions and maps RNA-seq reads. They employ a novel mapping paradigm called "seed-and-vote".

name: Subjunc
description: Superfast and accurate read aligners. Subread can be used to map both gDNA-seq and RNA-seq reads. Subjunc detects exon-exon junctions and maps RNA-seq reads. They employ a novel mapping paradigm called "seed-and-vote".

name: Taipan
description: de-novo Assembler for Illumina reads

name: UGENE
description: Visual interface both for Bowtie and BWA, as well as an embedded aligner

name: VelociMapper
description: FPGA-accelerated reference sequence alignment mapping tool from TimeLogic. Faster than Burrows-Wheeler transform-based algorithms like BWA and Bowtie. Supports up to 7 mismatches and/or indels with no performance penalty. Produces sensitive Smith-Waterman gapped alignments.

name: XpressAlign
description: FPGA based sliding window short read aligner which exploits the embarrassingly parallel property of short read alignment. Performance scales linearly with number of transistors on a chip (i.e. performance guaranteed to double with each iteration of Moore's Law without modification to algorithm). Low power consumption is useful for datacentre equipment. Predictable runtime. Better price/performance than software sliding window aligners on current hardware, but not better than software BWT-based aligners currently. Can cope with large numbers (>2) of mismatches. Will find all hit positions for all seeds. Single-FPGA experimental version, needs work to develop it into a multi-FPGA production version.

name: ZOOM
description: 100% sensitivity for a reads between 15 - 240bp with practical mismatches. Very fast. Support insertions and deletions. Works with Illumina & SOLiD instruments, not 454.

name: SOAPsplice
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC

name: PASSion
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC

name: SpliceMap
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC

name: TrueSight
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC

name: GEM
splice_side_model: user defined regular expression and know junctions

name: X-Mate
splice_reads: recursive mapping to genome and junctions

name: RNASEQR
splice_reads: Bowtie and BLAT on transcripts and genome

name: RUM
splice_reads: Bowtie and BLAT on transcripts and genome

name: ABMMapper
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC

name: MapNext
splice_side_model: Know -junctions and GT-AG for novel ones

name: STAR
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC and unbiased

name: GSNAP
splice_side_model: Exact match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC

name: OLEgo
splice_side_model: combined model of splice-site sequence and intron length

name: OSA
splice_side_model: Know and splice-sites and exct match to GT-AG, GC-AG, AT-AC
